pdftron.PDF

Class Convert.XPSOutputCommonOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • pdftron.PDF.Convert.XPSOutputCommonOptions
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Convert.XODOutputOptions, Convert.XPSOutputOptions
    Enclosing class:
    Convert

    public static class Convert.XPSOutputCommonOptions
extends java.lang.Object
    A class containing options common to ToXps and ToXod functions

    • Method Detail

      • setPrintMode

        public void setPrintMode(boolean print_mode)
                  throws PDFNetException
        Sets whether ToXps should be run in print mode. Default is false.
        Parameters:
        print_mode - if true print mode is enabled
        Throws:
        PDFNetException

      • setDPI

        public void setDPI(int dpi)
            throws PDFNetException
        The output resolution, from 1 to 1000, in Dots Per Inch (DPI) at which to render elements which cannot be directly converted. Default is 150.
        Parameters:
        dpi - the resolution in Dots Per Inch
        Throws:
        PDFNetException

      • setRenderPages

        public void setRenderPages(boolean render)
                    throws PDFNetException
        Sets whether rendering of pages should be permitted when necessary to guarantee output. Default is true.
        Parameters:
        render - if false rendering is not permitted under any circumstance
        Throws:
        PDFNetException

      • setThickenLines

        public void setThickenLines(boolean thicken)
                     throws PDFNetException
        Sets whether thin lines should be thickened. Default is true.
        Parameters:
        thicken - if true then thin lines will be thickened
        Throws:
        PDFNetException

      • generateURLLinks

        public void generateURLLinks(boolean generate)
                      throws PDFNetException
        Sets whether links should be generated from urls found in the document. Default is false.
        Parameters:
        generate - if true links will be generated from urls
        Throws:
        PDFNetException

      • setOverprint

        public void setOverprint(int mode)
                  throws PDFNetException
        Enable or disable support for overprint and overprint simulation. Overprint is a device dependent feature and the results will vary depending on the output color space and supported colorants (i.e. CMYK, CMYK+spot, RGB, etc). Default is e_op_pdfx_on.
        Parameters:
        op - e_op_on: always enabled; e_op_off: always disabled; e_op_pdfx_on: enabled for PDF/X files only.
        Throws:
        PDFNetException
